verses.kjv: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
verses.ct: LORD, don't correct me while you're angry, and don't discipline me in your burning frustration.

verses.kjv: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are vexed.
verses.ct: Show me mercy, LORD, because I am fading. LORD, heal me — my body is in agony.

verses.kjv: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O LORD, how long?
verses.ct: My soul is deeply tormented too. But you, LORD — how much longer will this last?

verses.kjv: Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies’ sake.
verses.ct: Come back to me, LORD, and rescue my soul. Save me because of your mercy.

verses.kjv: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?
verses.ct: No one remembers you after they die. Who can thank you from the grave?

verses.kjv: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.
verses.ct: I'm exhausted from my groaning. Every night I drench my bed — I soak my pillow with tears.

verses.kjv: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.
verses.ct: My eyes have grown weak from sorrow; they've aged because of all my enemies.

verses.kjv: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.
verses.ct: Get away from me, all of you who practice evil, because the LORD has heard my desperate crying.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.
verses.ct: The LORD has heard my plea for help; the LORD will accept my prayer.

verses.kjv: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return and be ashamed suddenly.
verses.ct: Let all my enemies be humiliated and deeply shaken. Let them retreat in sudden disgrace.
